snippet: Two Arab countries, Egypt and Tunisia, are moving in radically different directions.
abstract: Editorial warns Egypt is on verge of enacting Constitution that would legitimize 2013 coup and enable authoritarian rule by giving power and immunity to military; observes that, by contrast, Tunisia is set to approve one of most liberal constitutions in Arab world; holds impending election of Gen Abdul-Fattah el-Sisi in Egypt may bring stability but it will be at expense of democracy.
lead_paragraph: Two Arab countries, Egypt and Tunisia, are moving in radically different directions.

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
